intro: Actinophloeus guppyanus, commonly known as the Guppy's sphaerocarp, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, spherical fruits that resemble tiny balls, giving it its common name. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation and coastal ecology.
